DataElement.preferredName: Patient Hepatitis B Antibody Positive HBV Undetectable Viral Load Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator to determine clinical trial participation for questions related to Hepatitis B Virus Core Antibody Positive and HBV undetectable viral load as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Hepatitis B Virus Core Antibody Positive Hepatitis B Virus Undetectable Viral Load Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._An indication that antibodies that recognize a hepatitis B virus core protein have been detected in a sample._Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) is the prototype of the Hepadnavirus Family.  Included in the family are the Woodchuck Hepatitis Virus (WHV) and the Duck Hepatitis B Virus (DHBV) which provide animal models of infection.  The HBV genome is a partially double stranded circular DNA.  A viral reverse transcriptase is bound to the 5' extremity of the long strand._The inability to be noticed, identified or discovered._The number of viral particles (usually HIV) in a sample of blood plasma._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Hepatitis B Virus Core Antibody Positive Hepatitis B Virus Undetectable Viral Load Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: An indication that antibodies that recognize a hepatitis B virus core protein have been detected in a sample.:Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) is the prototype of the Hepadnavirus Family.  Included in the family are the Woodchuck Hepatitis Virus (WHV) and the Duck Hepatitis B Virus (DHBV) which provide animal models of infection.  The HBV genome is a partially double stranded circular DNA.  A viral reverse transcriptase is bound to the 5' extremity of the long strand.:The inability to be noticed, identified or discovered.:The number of viral particles (usually HIV) in a sample of blood plasma.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.longName: Hepatitis B Virus Core Antibody Positive
Concepts.definition: An indication that antibodies that recognize a hepatitis B virus core protein have been detected in a sample.

Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) is the prototype of the Hepadnavirus Family.  Included in the family are the Woodchuck Hepatitis Virus (WHV) and the Duck Hepatitis B Virus (DHBV) which provide animal models of infection.  The HBV genome is a partially double stranded circular DNA.  A viral reverse transcriptase is bound to the 5' extremity of the long strand.
The inability to be noticed, identified or discovered.
The number of viral particles (usually HIV) in a sample of blood plasma.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient has isolated posit
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has isolated positive hepatitis B core antibody (i.e., in the setting of negative hepatitis B surface antigen and negative hepatitis B surface antibody), is hepatitis B viral load undetectable?
